intro: Ochrocarpos ovalifolius, commonly known as the oval-leafed ochrocarpus, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
